text: this flight took off after the
authorities had already lifted the land
warning for typhoon mat mo in our more
than an hour earlier so the typhoon had
a really left Taiwan and it had already
started moving toward China so the
flight didn't take off until more than
an hour after the local authorities
thought it was safe to fly again but
then a local fire department spokesman
told me that at the time of the crash
there was still lightning and rain in
the area so this display must have
encountered some problems in the air for
it to try to abort its initial landing
and go to a go-around to try to land
again but however it lost contact with
the control tower around 70 6pm and a
crash shortly after that into two
residences about two kilometers from the
runway of Mahjong airport we know for a
fact that there were 58 people on board
including 54 passengers in four crew
members so only 11 survivors have been
found and those are the 11 injured taken
to hospital so the remaining 47 people
now the authorities so may have found no
other survivors so it's assumed that
these 47 people are have been killed
although they have not confirmed this
